data.title: Hidalgo County, TX
data.meta_description: In 2022, Hidalgo County, TX had a population of 873k people with a median age of 29.8 and a median household income of $49,371. Between 2021 and 2022 the population of Hidalgo County, TX grew from 865,677 to 873,167, a 0.865% increase and its median household income grew from $44,666 to $49,371, a 10.5% increase.
data.text:
Hidalgo County, TX is home to a population of 873k people, from which 81.9% are citizens. As of 2022, 26.1% of Hidalgo County, TX residents were born outside of the country (228k people).

In 2022, there were 1.25 times more White (Hispanic) residents (396k people) in Hidalgo County, TX than any other race or ethnicity. There were 316k Two+ (Hispanic) and 92.9k Other (Hispanic) residents, the second and third most common ethnic groups.

The economy of Hidalgo County, TX employs 341k people. The largest industries in Hidalgo County, TX are Health Care & Social Assistance (52,627 people), Educational Services (43,022 people), and Retail Trade (42,432 people), and the highest paying industries are Mining, Quarrying, & Oil & Gas Extraction ($56,893), Public Administration ($49,701), and Utilities ($47,085).

Males in Texas have an average income that is 1.38 times higher than the average income of females, which is $58,213. The income inequality in Texas (measured using the Gini index) is 0.476, which is lower than than the national average.

In the 2020 presidential election, the popular vote in Hidalgo County, TX went to Joseph R Biden Jr. with 58% of the vote. The runner-up was Donald J. Trump (41%), followed by Jo Jorgensen (0.571%).

John Cornyn and Ted Cruz are the senators currently representing the state of Texas. In the United States, senators are elected to 6-year terms with the terms for individual senators staggered.

Texas is currently represented by 38 members in the U.S. house, and members of the House of Representives are elected to 2-year terms.

In 2022, universities in Hidalgo County, TX awarded 15,704 degrees. The student population of Hidalgo County, TX in 2022 is skewed towards women, with 25,740 male students and 37,861 female students.

Most students graduating from Universities in Hidalgo County, TX are Hispanic or Latino (14,465 and 92.4%), followed by White (644 and 4.11%), Asian (223 and 1.42%), and Black or African American (183 and 1.17%).

The largest universities in Hidalgo County, TX by number of degrees awarded are The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley (7,128 and 45.4%), South Texas College (5,616 and 35.8%), and Rio Grande Valley College (476726) (582 and 3.71%).

The most popular majors in Hidalgo County, TX are General Studies (955 and 6.08%), General Business Administration & Management (773 and 4.92%), and General Biological Sciences (687 and 4.37%).

The median tuition cost in Hidalgo County, TX for a public four year colleges is $5,234 for in-state students and $12,575 for out-of-state students.

The median property value in Hidalgo County, TX was $112,700 in 2022, which is 0.4 times smaller than the national average of $281,900. Between 2021 and 2022 the median property value increased from $94,600 to $112,700, a 19.1% increase. The homeownership rate in Hidalgo County, TX is 67.8%, which is approximately the same as the national average of 64.8%.

People in Hidalgo County, TX have an average commute time of 22.9 minutes, and they drove alone to work. Car ownership in Hidalgo County, TX is approximately the same as the national average, with an average of 2 cars per household.

Median household income in Hidalgo County, TX is $49,371. In 2022, the tract with the highest Median Household Income in Hidalgo County, TX was Census Tract 207.24 with a value of $75,799, followed by Census Tract 224.02 and Census Tract 243.01, with respective values of $72,000 and $63,977.

In 2023, 25% of the population was living with severe housing problems in Hidalgo County, TX. From 2014 to 2023, the indicator declined 3.23%.

69% of the population of Hidalgo County, TX has health coverage, with 25.1% on employee plans, 27.2% on Medicaid, 6.4% on Medicare, 9.48% on non-group plans, and 0.787% on military or VA plans.

Primary care physicians in Hidalgo County, TX see 2156 patients per year on average, which represents a 0.231% decrease from the previous year (2161 patients). Compare this to dentists who see 3297 patients per year, and mental health providers who see 1289 patients per year.

By gender, of the total number of insured persons, 49% were men and 51% were women.
